summary: Henry P. Lopez was a CIA asset who worked for the Mexico City Station from 1961 to 1966. He was involved in operational activities and intelligence gathering in Spain, and his activities, expenses, and cover arrangements with the CIA are documented. He was also involved in discussions regarding influencing Fidel Castro and exploiting weaknesses within his regime. After his work with the Mexico City Station, he was employed as a legal consultant for WUSALINE in New York City. The House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) requested assistance from the CIA to interview him in Mexico.
significance: Henry P. Lopez is of interest to the JFK assassination context because the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) sought to interview him in Mexico. The documents suggest his involvement in CIA activities in Mexico and Spain, as well as his potential knowledge of operations related to Cuba and Fidel Castro. His connections to the CIA and his presence in Mexico, a location of interest in the JFK assassination, make him a person of interest for investigation.
